heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 04 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwave.status: There is currently no heatwave.  This year there have been 6 heatwaves, usually there are 1.9 heatwaves per year.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.0°C) and outside temperature (down 6.5°C), more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%), and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 14677 lux), cloud levels (up 641 m), and pressure (down 12 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 12818 lux) and cloud levels (up 1317 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 641.2m lower than yesterday, 270.9m lower than the past week, 1317.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 767m and a high of 3570m, averaging 1211.3m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, humidity should not be a concern and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and light levels will be low during the day. Similar weather conditions should remain.
